sn1.71:1.2: Standing to one side, that deity addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn1.71:2.1: “When what is incinerated do you sleep at ease?
sn1.71:2.2: When what is incinerated is there no sorrow?
sn1.71:3.1: “When anger’s incinerated you sleep at ease.
sn1.71:3.2: When anger’s incinerated there is no sorrow.
sn1.71:3.3: O deity, anger has a poisonous root
sn1.71:3.5: The noble ones praise its killing,
sn1.71:3.6: for when it’s incinerated there is no sorrow.”
